page.title: 05HALLATON SHOPPING FACILITIES
page.content: The only shop in the three villages is the{Hallaton Store and Post Office,}an important focus of village life. It stocks most household needs, and many villagers do a substantial part of their weekly shopping there. Prices and limited choice, however, result in other people shopping mostly in Market Harborough, Uppingham, Leicester or Corby. The village shop is a meeting place and gives opportunity, particu- larly to the elderly, for a walk around the village. Once there were 19 shops in Hallaton: the only other remaining now is an{Antiques Shop}next to the Post Office, which just opens on Sunday afternoons. In addition, there is a visiting greengrocer on Thursdays, a bread van three days a week, and a fish and chip van on Thursday evening. A doctor is at Torch House twice a week for consultation.
